definition: to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
variant of 鑑|鉴[jian4]
old variant of 鑒|鉴[jian4]
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
variant of 鑑|鉴[jian4]

sentences.english: We have the example of the banking system and the car industry.
sentences.chinese: 我们有着金融和汽车行业的前车之鉴。

sentences.english: Their oblivious behavior reminds me to question the daily decisions I make in my own life and make sure I'm learning from past experiences.
sentences.chinese: 他们的行为也会提醒我在做决定的时候注意前车之鉴。

sentences.english: I survived them so why shouldn't she listen to me and take in the knowledge that I had from the experiences of my past.
sentences.chinese: 我是过来人，为什么她就是听不进我的前车之鉴呢？

sentences.english: One of the voices utterly mops the floor  with all of the others.
sentences.chinese: 他的论点之一完全扫清了他人的前车之鉴。

sentences.english: But the lesson of Japan is that nothing is inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 但日本的前车之鉴表明了没有什么事是不可避免的。
